subject: Adds Programming OpenStack Compute API with Shell and Python book
messages:
[{'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-01-28 16:47:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

What's the long-term plan for dealing with Markdown-formatted documentation? Are we going to:

a. (Manually) convert it to docbook?
b. Automatically convert it to HTML/PDF?
c. ???"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-01-28 17:36:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My plan is to have Jenkins convert it to DocBook and then do "normal" outputs from that so the styling is all the same on docs.openstack.org. Sound good? Just need to work on the Jenkins side.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-01-28 20:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sounds like a plan to me.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 15:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-02 16:50:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

It looks like there's some text that got accidentally inserted by git because of a merge resolve (see inline), but otherwise I think this is good to go."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 19:19:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 19:19:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ah, thanks Lorin, should be all set now.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 19:24:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hm, sorry no it's not. Want to set this to "in progress" - I think what's happening is that the pandoc makes the top-level element a "section" but the pom file wants to build a "book" or "chapter" maybe. It shouldn't really matter but I can work more on it.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-03 01:38:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

OK, I'll assume this is still in progress and will hold off on +2 until hearing otherwise."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-03 02:15:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Yeah, thanks, I will work with the doc tools guys tomorrow - it's basically converting to docbook4 but our toolset needs docbook5. We can fix that with another preprocessing step but I need to test first."}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-03 14:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-03 15:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-03 20:30:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I'm going to go ahead and approve this since the content is good it's just the backend publishing we're waiting on. This will let me push through the other one that is a dependency (didn't mean to do that but it was bug squash day and darn it I wanted to squash a bug.) :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-03 20:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/openstack-manuals/112/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-03 20:30:15.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Converted Quantum to Datatables.

This is known to be broken with current quantum APIs,
but it is a proper refactor of the previous tables using
the new DataTables, modals, and exception handling.

It makes future updates for API compatibility much easier.

Change-Id: I9690db8553773f40d8aad88ffde90b26815bfed2

commit_message:
Move cfg to nova.openstack.common

Move it here so that it can be kept in sync with openstack-common using
the new update.py script for code in openstack-common's incubation area.

See here for more details:

  http://wiki.openstack.org/CommonLibrary#Incubation

Note: this commit just moves the existing code in Nova with no other
changes. A subsequent commit will sync it with latest openstack-common
so that it is easier see the new changes.

Change-Id: If88d678b1b9bad3d37117de7f7159d7fea8ab4c8

commit_message:
Use Keystone Extension Syntax for EC2 Creds

- Syntax is OS-KSEC2:ec2Credentials (not ec2Credentials)
- adds to fix for bug 917408
- Syntax also requires a call to /tokens instead of /ec2tokens
- Changes are compatible (old syntax supported)
- Warning will be issued to log if URL syntax is old

Change-Id: I5ff9d1643122de2f383517e60f15852720c54490

subject: Raise ApiError in response to InstanceTypeNotFound
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2035, 'name': 'Maru Newby', 'email': 'marun@redhat.com', 'username': 'maru'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-02 22:08:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

Looks good; I have a couple of minor nits, but they don't need to delay the patch."}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-03 08:11:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2035, 'date': '2012-02-03 08:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-03 16:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-03 16:41:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I would prefer a slightly different approach. I think we are overusing APIError.  APIError was intended to be an EC2 specific set of errors that EC2 could understand and return in an error message.  Wrapping in a generic error at the compute.API level means that we can't always return the proper error code at the higher level ec2 and openstack apis.

An example of this is in the openstack apis is we want to be able to return 404s for various not founds and perhaps 409s for duplicates. If we wrap the underlying rich exception info in ApiError, we lose important information. Therefore I suggest that compute.API and by extension compute.volume_types, and compute.instance_types returns rich errors and we wrap them at the ec2 layer to a specific ApiError and and at the osapi layer to specific HTTP exceptions.

That said this is a larger set of changes, so we can make this change and do that refactor later."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-03 18:28:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Vish: I absolutely agree with you. Let's get this in and I'll fix the bigger problem in a future patch. I went ahead and filed a bug here: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/926250"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-03 18:29:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

In that case. (I will update the conflicts in my branch)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-03 18:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

commit_message:
Raise ApiError in response to InstanceTypeNotFound

 * Updates methods in nova.compute.instance_types to catch
   InstanceTypeNotFound exceptions and re-raise them as ApiError.
   - Previously, the methods in instance_types were raising ApiError in
     response to DBError, but the underlying db calls have since been
     updated to detect empty results and throw more specific exceptions.
 * Updates get_instance_type_by_flavor_id to not try to catch DBError,
   as the underlying db call only ever raises FlavorNotFound.
   get_instance_type_by_flavor_id should not raise ApiError, as callers
   expect the FlavorNotFound exception and know how to handle it.
 * Fixes bug 872618

Change-Id: I8652f04889adb448017afd253ecdcc840fbb660f

commit_message:
EC2Token: Return 401 for unauthorized requests

Instead of returning a trace + a 400 client, catch the 401 from Keystone
and raise the appropriate exception.

Fixes bug 922373

Change-Id: Ic16e50db4e8019bb4ce06619c34d642520cbe78f

commit_message:
Rename .keystone-venv to .venv.

This simplifies a number of Jenkins jobs which currently, other
than directory names, could be the same for all OpenStack
projects.  By renaming the virtualenv directory, the redundant
Jenkins virtualenv build and copy jobs can be eliminated.

Cherry-picked from: ff30def8899c36626eacbbd5c2266c1a7b72d2cd

Cc: stable-maintainers

Conflicts:

	.gitignore
	AUTHORS
	doc/source/developing.rst

Change-Id: Ia831674b6e9c9d2be25b54e26c92009778d97a22

 * Fixes bug 917408

commit_message:
blueprint nova-image-cache-management phase1

Phase 1 of the image-cache-management blueprint. Implement
checksumming and verification of base images, as well as
removal of base images which are not in use. Removal is
enabled with a flag.

Change-Id: Ib04a02075a103c2fef6716fd0ac87c41a3535d37

I am using the WADL normalizer tool from https://github.com/rackspace/wadl-tools which is also an Oxygen plugin. You can get a copy of Oxygen for free since you are working on OpenStack documents, they are big supporters of open Source. Or you can just run the script from the wadl normalizer tool to find the references that are not yet mapped.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 16:42:53.000000000', 'message': "Update auth_token middleware to support creds.

Updates to the auth_token middleware to support admin_user and
admin_password in addition to the existing admin_token. If an
admin_token isn't specified then a call to obtain the admin_token
is made. If an admin token expires the username and password can
also be used to obtain a fresh token.

Fixes LP Bug #923573.

Change-Id: I643efec310cbb9a175607cc17f0c077f261b1d6d
"}, {'created': '2012-02-02 17:15:38.000000000', 'message': "Update auth_token middleware to support creds.

Updates to the auth_token middleware to support admin_user and
admin_password in addition to the existing admin_token. If an
admin_token isn't specified then a call to obtain the admin_token
is made. If an admin token expires the username and password can
also be used to obtain a fresh token.

Fixes LP Bug #923573.

Change-Id: I643efec310cbb9a175607cc17f0c077f261b1d6d
"}, {'created': '2012-02-02 22:25:03.000000000', 'message': "Update auth_token middleware to support creds.

Updates to the auth_token middleware to support admin_user and
admin_password in addition to the existing admin_token. If an
admin_token isn't specified then a call to obtain the admin_token
is made. If an admin token expires the username and password can
also be used to obtain a fresh token.

Also, added a test for case for middleware where token isn't
specified.

Fixes LP Bug #923573.

Change-Id: I643efec310cbb9a175607cc17f0c077f261b1d6d
"}]
commit_message:
Update auth_token middleware to support creds.

Updates to the auth_token middleware to support admin_user and
admin_password in addition to the existing admin_token. If an
admin_token isn't specified then a call to obtain the admin_token
is made. If an admin token expires the username and password can
also be used to obtain a fresh token.

Also, added a test for case for middleware where token isn't
specified.

Fixes LP Bug #923573.

Change-Id: I643efec310cbb9a175607cc17f0c077f261b1d6d

commit_message:
Blueprint cli-auth: common cli args

Remove os_ from internal variable names corresponding to OS_ env
variables.

Strip trailing '/' from --auth_url since server doesn't seem to
tolerate '//' in the URL path.

Fixes lp923920

Change-Id: I3e48441d63b6504fd088aa07241f66d63590d935

Blueprint cli-auth: common cli args

Depricate --apikey, --projectid, --url (though still present for
compatibility).  Fully support OS_* env vars per
http://wiki.openstack.org/CLIAuth Password Flow.

Fixes lp897304

Fix for bug 921494. Clients should be able to
connect using SSL without specifying a client-side
key or cert.

commit_message:
Keystone config file needs to be owned by keystone user.

Since the keystone service runs as the keystone user, the
/etc/keystone/keystone.conf needs to be owned by the keystone user it the
service won't start.

Change-Id: I150499350d1d13495fb34e81e67f8e7d2e5e8339

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 23:41:06.000000000', 'message': 'PEP8 type comparison cleanup

Fixes bug #910295

The None, True, and False values are singletons.

All variable *comparisons* to singletons should use 'is' or 'is not'.
All variable *evaluations* to boolean should use 'if' or 'if not'.

"== None", "== True", "== False", and "!= None" comparisons in sqlalchemy's
where(), or_(), filter(), and_(), and select() functions should not be changed.

Incorrect comparisons or evaluations in comments were not changed.

Change-Id: I087f0883bf115b5fe714ccfda86a794b9b2a87f7
'}]
commit_message:
PEP8 type comparison cleanup

Fixes bug #910295

The None, True, and False values are singletons.

All variable *comparisons* to singletons should use 'is' or 'is not'.
All variable *evaluations* to boolean should use 'if' or 'if not'.

"== None", "== True", "== False", and "!= None" comparisons in sqlalchemy's
where(), or_(), filter(), and_(), and select() functions should not be changed.

Incorrect comparisons or evaluations in comments were not changed.

Change-Id: I087f0883bf115b5fe714ccfda86a794b9b2a87f7

subject: Fixes logic for toggle Pause/Suspend action buttons Fixes bug 925395. When changing the behavior of a Action Button, the label should be changed accordingly. Implemented as a new ToggleBatchAction class, that inherits BatchAction, and adds action_present_toggle and action_past_toggle verbose labels. The labels should be applied when changing the Action state. This happens in two cases: 1. On GET request - when the VM instance state is already changed (in update() method) 2. On POST request - when submitting an action change - only for the toggling action
messages:
[{'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-02-02 20:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-02-02 21:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The patch does fix the bug, and I could get behind the idea of making toggling a bit more intuitive (not that using the existing "update" method is actually difficult). However, the API needs some work:

The whole thing would be better implemented as part of the base Action class. It would need to be implemented in such a way that the developer only needs to override a single method which would handle the evaluation of which state the action should be in (default implementation would always return the default state). Everything else should be implemented such that it checks with that function.

Additionally, it should support N states, rather than just two. If you don't want to take that on in this patch, then you can accomplish exactly what you did here with the update method.'}, {'account_id': 2455, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Will propose new patch.'}]

commit_message:
Fixes logic for toggle Pause/Suspend action buttons
Fixes bug 925395. When changing the behavior of a Action Button, the label should be changed accordingly.
Implemented as a new ToggleBatchAction class, that inherits BatchAction, and adds action_present_toggle
and action_past_toggle verbose labels. The labels should be applied when changing the Action state.
This happens in two cases:
1. On GET request - when the VM instance state is already changed (in update() method)
2. On POST request - when submitting an action change - only for the toggling action

Change-Id: I4c29238a11c96a9041c703e7081bcce22b537338

commit_message:
fix stale libvirt images on download failure. Bug 801412

If we've just truncated/created the file to receive
the download, but the download fails, then delete the file.
Otherwise subsequent downloads would not be attempted.

Change-Id: Ibe9ba199b2f424d570ce7aedfb768ce283816a3b

Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2284, 'name': 'Eoghan Glynn', 'email': 'eglynn@redhat.com', 'username': 'eglynn'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-27 23:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-28 17:35:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Eoghan,

Any idea why this branch might hang the unit test runners on SmokeStack?'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-29 17:10:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan - the test hang seems to be Ubuntu-specific. I originally developed and tested the patch on Fedora-16, where the suite runs to completion.

I suspect some distro-specifics in the underpinnings of subprocess.Popen(), which is used in this patch to spwan /usr/bin/logger in order to capture the glance API & registry service stsdout/err via syslogd.

I've reproduced the hang on Ubuntu 10.04, and will work on a solution before submitting a patch set 2."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-30 00:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-30 00:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Patch set 3 resolves test suite hang on Ubuntu by replacing problematic Popen.communicate() call in test utility code with:

- explicit reads from piped stdout gated on select to avoid blocking

- a finite sequence of Popen.poll() calls before bailing on a clean subprocess termination.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-30 10:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-01-30 12:43:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sorry for being such a stick in the mud, but I'm really not comfortable applying workarounds to problems we don't understand. Can you come up with a small script that reproduces that hang on Ubuntu so that I can look into what might be causing it?"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-30 14:50:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Eoghan!

Is there a bug report that this should be tied to? Also, does https://answers.launchpad.net/glance/+question/186251 have anything to do with this?

Thanks!
-jay'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:07:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Jay,

I just reported a bug for this feature:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/923894

I don't think the hang previously observed on Ubuntu test runs is related to that issue you mentioned. The hang was only seen during test runs (not when glance-control/glance-api were launched manually), and occurred in the test utility code used to spawn glance-control (not within glance-control itself).

I suspect the issue may be related to the hierarchy of subprocesses launched via Popen from nose->glance-control->glance-api->/usr/bin/logger, and the way EOFs on pipes are detected. However I haven't narrowed it down further.

The work-around in patch set 3 allows the tests run to completion on both Fedora and Ubuntu.


Hi Soren,

Thanks for the feedback - I will strive to reproduce the test hang with a minimal testcase.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-30 22:53:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The manual scan with timeout looks too hacky to me.
When hung one might get the process that's hung using `pstree -p` and then `strace -p` on that to see if it's blocked reading or writing.

This bit of execute() looks a bit strange:
  stdin=subprocess.PIPE
process.stdin is not connected anywhere though.
So I would suggest that process.stdin.close() is
called before process.communicate()

If that doesn't fix, then I'd try adding the close_fds=True
param to the Popen constructor in case descriptors leaking into the children are causing adverse effects."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-30 23:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Just in case, these might also be worth investigating:

http://thraxil.org/users/anders/posts/2008/03/13/Subprocess-Hanging-PIPE-is-your-enemy/
http://bugs.python.org/issue4216#msg77582

Note lucid is on python 2.6 while Fedora is on 2.7,
so perhaps something got fixed in the meantime.

Unfortunately I use my own subprocess wrapper
(upon which the official python one was based),
so never noticed any of these implementation issues.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 14:09:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi Pádraig,

Thanks for the feedback and tips!

However I don't think either of the two leads you mention are relevant.

The problematic subprocess.Popen() call deliberately doesn't create a pipe to stdin, only stdout:

  process = subprocess.Popen(cmd,
                             shell=True,
                             stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
                             env=env)

Your other lead refers to stdio buffer exhaustion causing a hang, whereas glance-control only ever produces a few lines of text output, so it would never make a dent in a 64k buffer.

Now I'm really probing the edges of my Linux knowledge, but here's my current working theory ...

The relevant process interactions are as follows:

http://www.pastie.org/pastes/3288892/text

(pasted to avoid the ascii 'art' being mangled)

where T is test utils, GC is glance-control, P1 is glance-control's piped stdout, SL is sys logger and GA is glance-api.

It's the TU read call on P1 that's hanging *after* the parent GC process has exited.

On Fedora this read is interrupted on the child's death so the test run is unblocked. 

On Ubuntu, I'm seeing the initial read call return with ERESTARTSYS when the SIGCHLD is raised for the dead GC parent process, which causes the read to be restarted and block the test run.

The fact that ERESTARTSYS is thrown on Ubuntu and not on Fedora may be due to the WNOHANG flag being set on the relevant wait() call in the letter case. On Ubuntu, the dead GC parent process is reported as a zombie, suggesting its not even being wait()ed upon.

So hacky as the alternative approach in the test utils may seem, it does avoid that restarted read (which appears wrong under the circumstances).

Thoughts?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 14:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Actually that ERESTARTSYS may just be an artifact of the process  running with strace attached (as opposed to being caused by the SIGCHLD).'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 16:14:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Soren,

As requested, here's a minimal script reproducing the hang in the test utility logic.

$ wget https://s3.amazonaws.com/eglynn-tests/hung_pipe.tar.gz
$ tar xzf hung_pipe.tar.gz
$ python a.py      # ... runs to completion
$ python a.py hang # ... hangs on read from pipe

Using strace, you can clearly see the ERESTARTED behaviour refered to in previous comments, e.g.:

Non-hanging case where the child death leads to the read on the stdout pipe in a.py to be closed:

read(5, "exiting\n", 8192)              = 8
read(5, "", 8184)                       = 0
--- SIGCHLD (Child exited) @ 0 (0) ---
close(5)                                = 0
wait4(11815, [{WIFEXITED(s) && WEXITSTATUS(s) == 0}], 0, NULL) = 11815
...etc.

Hanging case where read is restarted just as the SIGCHLD is received to indicate the piped process has died:

read(5, "exiting\n", 8192)              = 8
read(5, 0x288b6ec, 8184)                = ? ERESTARTSYS (To be restarted)
--- SIGCHLD (Child exited) @ 0 (0) ---
read(5, 

Intestingly with this stripped-down test case, I can reproduce the hang on both Ubuntu 10.04 and Fedora 16.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 17:51:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

After finally taking proper notice of the slightly munged link in p-draigbrady's comment above:

http://bugs.python.org/issue4216#msg77582

I've set the close-on-exec flag explicitly on stdio FDs in glance-control to avoid the test utility code blocking on input from the grandchild process.

So the tests can run to completion on Ubuntu and Fedora without the test utils work-around (that gave the earlier reviewers pause).

I'll submit a cleaned-up patch set 5 presently ..."}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 18:27:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-01-31 18:36:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-31 22:09:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 21:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

This patch needs a slightly messy rebase to account for:

https://review.openstack.org/#change,3670

Please hold off +2'ing until I submit a rebased patch set."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:51:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Needs a rebase"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:04:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Approved

off it goes then...'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-unittests/89506/ : SUCCESS

https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-merge/330/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-pep8/505/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 23:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/glance-tarball/352/ : SUCCESS'}]

commit_message:
Add --capture-output option to glance-control.

Fixes bug 923894

Previously all stdout/err from glance services was discarded
if launched via glance-control.

The --capture-output option allows such output to be instead
captured in the syslog.

Non-termination output should be flushed to ensure timely
arrival in /var/log/messages.

Change-Id: I5c11ad4b9f7f321a3d1cab71e34c2a6707ef1b5e

commit_message:
Reworked all the usage implementations into one standard set.

Adds a base Usage data object, datatables, class-based views,
and more consistent templating for all cases.

Bumps environment version to ensure latest novaclient.

Fixes bug 922353.

Change-Id: Ib2042e9393c8deb0e3ec23403da55a6fb8dd39fb

commit_message:
remove auto fsck feature from file injection. Bug 826794

This is at least independent of file injection,
and as noted in the bug report is questionable
to do anyway.

commit_message:
Tail glance commands when parsing image refs.

Tail the glance image upload commands so that we look for the
image Ref's in the last line of output only. Fixes issues
with parsing glance image UUID's in the new progress uploader.

Change-Id: If6978c60393417e7180ea83399b2a4739028a01a

commit_message:
Coverage stats no longer incorrect.

Fixes coverage module discovery to provide coverage reports
for full project (including dashboards) and both the openstack-dashboard
project and the horizon app. Excludes horizon's venv from the report.

Change-Id: I17aab1daeec28dab972836682e138876d8dafcf4

commit_message:
Handle access restriction to public unowned image

Fixes bug 923941. Now we can return a 403 rather than a 404
if we reject a modification for a public image.

Change-Id: I71915f662c8e9e3ebf4326f47d0cd3bd08c03ac1

subject: Remove extraneous data from EC2 API
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 112, 'name': 'Jesse Andrews', 'email': 'anotherjesse@gmail.com', 'username': 'anotherjesse'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 518, 'name': 'Soren Hansen', 'email': 'soren@linux2go.dk', 'username': 'soren'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-01-29 17:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

this was added before the osapi for the dashboard.  this should be removed now'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-30 03:24:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

While we may only claim to support an older version of the EC2 API (2009-04-04) shouldn't we strive towards supporting more recent versions as well?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-30 04:47:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, but I don't want to support random pieces of future versions. This can be re-added when we fully support the latest spec and communicate that to our clients."}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-01-30 14:26:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

My usual stance on things like this is: We don't implement any version of the EC2 API in its entirety. We just add bits and pieces as the needs arise.

displayName seems like something that might be handy, and I don't see it getting in the way, so I'd prefer leaving it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-30 17:23:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Does it really make sense to provide undocumented information, though? No clients are going to code specifically to our implementation of the ec2 api. They will use euca2ools, which will only depend on what we explicitly claim to support. Additionally, 'displayName' isn't a valid attribute in the latest spec (2011-12-15); the correct key is 'name'. Providing 'displayName' is actually duplicating information already available through the 'imageLocation' attribute."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-02-02 00:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I agree with Soren on this one."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:57:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So would you prefer I leave 'displayName' as-is, or convert it to 'name' as the bug suggests?"}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-02-02 20:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Oh, sorry, I thought the EC2 meta-data service (at some version) gave a displayName attribute back and you wanted to get rid of it because we didn't support that given version in its entirety. If displayName is something that only exists in our implementation of the EC2 API and not in EC2's "real" API at all.

If EC2 gives similar information in a "name" attribute, I think it makes more sense to rename our "displayName" to just "name".'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-02 21:48:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Looks like Jesse actually removed displayName in his recent patch:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/62d5fae8d11b6403f9a63a709270ffafebb7ef09'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-02 21:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-01-29 05:19:07.000000000', 'message': "Remove extraneous data from EC2 API

Fixes bug 755829. We don't need to return displayName for
version 2009-04-04 of the EC2 API.

Change-Id: I49ff03dbf32c8fde6905a2149681eed68a91d7fa
"}]
commit_message:
Remove extraneous data from EC2 API

Fixes bug 755829. We don't need to return displayName for
version 2009-04-04 of the EC2 API.

Change-Id: I49ff03dbf32c8fde6905a2149681eed68a91d7fa

 * Sends the id from the instance when looking up vifs

commit_message:
Fixes uuid lookup in virtual interfaces extension

 * Makes virtual interfaces get the instance and pass it to network.api
 * Sends the id from the instance when looking up vifs
 * Repairs the tests
 * Fixes bug 925682

Change-Id: If25514246f30bfc983f26f7a8f1c35f33f8b9cc4

Adds install deploy guide to diablo so we can edit for essex
Changes pom file so that Disqus is enabled
Changes pom file so Jenkins builds work for both diablo and essex
Fixes problematic folder addition

subject: Don't block forever for rpc.(multi)call response.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-01 17:09:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does 10 seconds seem like a sane default to others?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-01 17:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It's so hard to know what "too long" is. I'd err on the side of being conservative. This is really to prevent calls from waiting forever, so something much longer (60 seconds? 300 seconds? 3600 seconds?) should be sufficient to eventually error out. I wouldn't feel comfortable with 10 right now without auditing all of the uses to make sure.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 18:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm with Johannes on this.  For point of information, I just measured a successful "nova boot", at the RPC layer, as taking 67 seconds.  Now that's likely a cast, rather than a call, but it is a point of information to bear in mind.  I'm going to suggest 5 minutes (300 seconds) as a reasonable starting point for discussion, with 10 seconds probably being too low :)'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 18:28:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree, I would prefer very long by default: 1 hour or more?  We are considering having a worker stop listening for messages and finishing up outstanding jobs before restarting a new version of the worker as a potential upgrade path.  So in some cases messages could be very delayed.

That said, it might be nice to be able to override it when calling rpc.call and be able to catch a TimeoutError or some such so that calls can be written to be expected to fail and do something intelligent.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 18:30:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The goal being: Calls that are in the direct path of a user response should have a short timeout, whereas backend calls should have a long timeout.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:23:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:24:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Changes:

1) Set the default timeout to 3600 seconds (1 hour).

2) Allow a timeout to be specified to rpc.call() or rpc.multicall() that overrides the configured (long) timeout.

3) Update all rpc implementations and unit tests.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-01 21:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Fails

Build Failed

commit_message:
Don't block forever for rpc.(multi)call response.

Fix bug 843200.

This patch adds a timeout for waiting for a response from rpc.call or
rpc.multicall instead of blocking for forever.

Change-Id: I5675597c7e9f3d55170837859ec516cb1c806ca3

commit_message:
Get rid of DeprecationWarning during db migration

Use proper syntax to rename column, which avoids printing
silly warnings and future deprecation issues.
Fixes bug 854163.

Change-Id: I7897b6bd15043ff1c3a5688b9ee775b33a0b0c22

Previously an immediate non-zero exit status from service
launch was not reflected in the exit status returned from
glance-control.

Now the parent glance-control process configurably waits for
the child to exit ungracefully and if this occurs, it inherits
the non-zero status code from the child.

commit_message:
Add --await-child option to glance-control.

Fixes bug 817032

Previously an immediate non-zero exit status from service
launch was not reflected in the exit status returned from
glance-control.

Now the parent glance-control process configurably waits for
the child to exit ungracefully and if this occurs, it inherits
the non-zero status code from the child.

Change-Id: Ibbe92a5bf40d095951a572d78ae07026d8a9313d

I very much like the spirit of this patch, but I'll add another small fix on the pile of -1's :)"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:14:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (5 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:39:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Brian - in respect to private being between 1 & 1000 due to speed - that makes sense - since other^big_num then modulus is hard.

If you use math you can do modulus more often (iirc modulus can occur each multiple) then you don't end up with huge numbers."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:39:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

also - maybe we should look if there is a library that isn't m2crypto that just does dh?"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-01 19:54:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

As an example, here's what Chris' test agent client does.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/4635/

It uses a much more efficient exponential doubling algorithm. It runs in 0.03 seconds versus a very long time for your implementation (I stopped waiting after a couple of minutes).

I'd lean towards not requiring another library for just DH. It's simple enough that another dependency doesn't seem worth it."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:10:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

Maybe using a library would be best since this is security related. It would ensure we're doing it right since we appear to be using a short key as it is."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-01 21:28:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-01 21:31:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the code, Johannes. I just plugged it in and the calculation is impressively faster. Turns out pythons pow is horrible :)

I really don't think it's necessary to depend on a separate library, as this is an extremely simple algorithm. The communication is also contained within the compute node, so its not visible to the public."}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-02-01 23:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Begone M2Crypto!'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 23:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

(1 inline comment)

I see we are using pycrypto for AES (good), we need to add that to the pip-requires.

commit_message:
Excise M2Crypto!

This required rewriting our Diffie-Hellman-Merkle implementation for
set_admin_password in xen. Fixes bug 917851.

Change-Id: Ic4cdcc06221f003aec2dcd5ba05a1a9ad19d39c9

subject: Container's HEAD response must include ACL
messages:
[{'account_id': 330, 'date': '2012-02-02 17:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can not reproduce the bug that is being fixed here, either manually or with the attached script on the bug report.'}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2012-02-02 17:58:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Its proxy server is working the way it should.  The proxy only removes those headers when the user is not an admin to the account.  Non-admin users shouldn't be allowed to see the read/write acls."}, {'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:04:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We can reproduce it since 1.4.3 with an admin account.

I'll check tomorrow if the bug is related to the custom authentication middleware we're using."}, {'account_id': 995, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:13:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It would make sense that it would be the custom auth middle ware.  Probably not setting the swift_owner env variable for admins'}, {'account_id': 894, 'date': '2012-02-02 18:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Thanks David, it makes sense.

swift_owner variable was introduced in 1.4.3.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 10:55:46.000000000', 'message': "Container's HEAD response must include ACL

X-Container-Read and X-Container-Write must be included in the response. Fixes bug 879371.

Container ACL is supposed to be included in responses to HEAD requests over a container.
These headers were removed when container to container sync was implemented.

Change-Id: Iee771a7951b2c39f98d3d13c33c2df4561487aee
"}]
commit_message:
Container's HEAD response must include ACL

X-Container-Read and X-Container-Write must be included in the response. Fixes bug 879371.

Container ACL is supposed to be included in responses to HEAD requests over a container.
These headers were removed when container to container sync was implemented.

Change-Id: Iee771a7951b2c39f98d3d13c33c2df4561487aee

subject: Optionally disable file locking.
messages:
[{'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-02 16:52:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just want to add some additional motivation in the comments here.

This change can be seen as a partial fix to Bug #785955. I initially tried to come up with a proper solution by moving away from the lockfile library. However, there is immediately the question of portability. I'm not sure how important it is, but the only code I could develop to work around this would be for linux. 

Secondly, linux fcntl file-based process locks always leave a file behind (this doesn't prevent them from working however). But there is never an opportunity to clean those files up, so it seems like it would be trading one deployer problem for another."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-02 16:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-02-02 17:23:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 16:41:18.000000000', 'message': "Optionally disable file locking.

File locks in nova have a bad habit of lingering if the process that
created them is killed, and there isn't a good automated way to fix this
behavior. This option allows a deployer to avoid the problem if they
know they are only running a single nova process on a machine.

Change-Id: I1ae20cc54a4614b200093ffd581d3ab21d7c241b
"}]
commit_message:
Optionally disable file locking.

File locks in nova have a bad habit of lingering if the process that
created them is killed, and there isn't a good automated way to fix this
behavior. This option allows a deployer to avoid the problem if they
know they are only running a single nova process on a machine.

Change-Id: I1ae20cc54a4614b200093ffd581d3ab21d7c241b

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 11:57:35.000000000', 'message': "Consistent timestamp formatting for last_modified.

Fixes bug 798268.

Python datetime's isoformat() uses %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f format, but
the miliseconds part is not included when it's zero.

As consequence the compliant ISO 8601 format was not consistent
when performing a GET request over a container (listing objects info).

Change-Id: Ifed3f0adf3eaca47304c142615169bd3f1901631
"}]
commit_message:
Consistent timestamp formatting for last_modified.

Fixes bug 798268.

Python datetime's isoformat() uses %Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%f format, but
the miliseconds part is not included when it's zero.

As consequence the compliant ISO 8601 format was not consistent
when performing a GET request over a container (listing objects info).

Change-Id: Ifed3f0adf3eaca47304c142615169bd3f1901631

commit_message:
Avoid weird test error when mox is missing

Fail early if you can't import mox, rather than return
a cryptic and undecipherable error. Fixes bug 810424.

Change-Id: Ie56d3e7447bbba841fdc882cb1f8f70e234812ef

So, the idea here is that there's a pre-build step on Jenkins that runs pandoc -o filename.mkdown filename.xml and then the mvn clean generate-sources runs on the pom.xml. The docbook is then a fleeting state. I hadn't thought about how hard it is to review - other than reviewing markdown diffs should be easier than XML diffs. Does this plan sound okay?"}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 02:09:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also I may need to abandon this one and try to update the original. I did git review -3515, then edits, then git commit -a --amend -m 'Adds a pom to markdown files directory for automation work' then git review which I thought would update the 3515 review. Rats. :)"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-02-02 02:27:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think generating ephemeral XML files on Jenkins is the right thing to do, but I also think we should capture how to generate HTML/PDF, so reviewers can do it locally. Could you add instructions to the top-level README.rst about how to build xml from mkdown?

Also, I've tried to manually run the pandoc command on my machine, and then "mvn clean generate-sources", and I still can't build". Can you confirm it works? 

I started with the command here <https://jenkins.openstack.org/view/Openstack-manuals/job/openstack-compute-programmers-guide-mkdwn/configure>, but I don't think that's correct.

I think the command needs to be something like:

 pandoc -t docbook openstackapi-programming.mdown -o openstackapi-programming.xml

But if I do this and try to generate, I get the error: http://paste.openstack.org/show/4644/

I think this may be the key error: "This template requires a docbook title!"'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-02-02 16:11:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Meant to patch the original review, not add a new review. Please ignore this one.'}]

messages:
[{'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-29 19:08:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Hi Pavan!

Good stuff! I have one thing to correct, though...

Please create a new exception class in glance.common.exception called StorageFull and instead of catching on IOError inside of the images controller, catch on StorageFull. You will then need to modify the Filesystem driver in glance/store/filesystem.py and trap the IOError appropriate on writing to the storage media and re-raise StorageFull.

This way we can generalize the exception across all the storage drivers (which may not raise IOError themselves to indicate a storage media full error).

Also, could you look into adding a unit test that stresses this new code path? You can use stubout to force the write of the image file to throw an IOError. Look in the existing code for examples of using stbout...

Thanks!
-jay"}, {'account_id': 2405, 'date': '2012-02-02 13:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-02-02 15:22:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

subject: Do not pass image ref through database for rebuild
messages:
[{'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-01-25 06:03:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Also see https://review.openstack.org/#change,3367 as there's come strategizing going on between these two changes."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-26 20:06:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not submit

Mark,

I'm seeing issues with this branch w/ Torpedo.

In Torpedo we rebuild with a new image ref... I looks like this change prevents it from being returned via the API correctly.

test_030_rebuild(Torpedo::Compute::Servers)
    [/var/lib/gems/1.8/gems/torpedo-1.0.13/lib/torpedo/compute/servers.rb:105:in `check_server'
     /var/lib/gems/1.8/gems/torpedo-1.0.13/lib/torpedo/compute/servers.rb:284:in `test_030_rebuild']:
<"ac6b2fa2-9b18-4761-ae33-a4b56d224f53"> expected but was
<"8fa02cbe-3271-4555-a368-704d481a326a">.

As you can see the expected image UUID was not found.'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2012-02-02 01:06:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

The OS api is returning the data on the instance right after it casts to compute.rebuild. since you've moved the location where you are updating the instance in the db from the api, to the compute worker, the image returned from the api is the old one. This is what's causing the test failure."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2012-02-02 15:52:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Guys,
Thanks for catching the problem here. I see now that the db update is partly for the subsequent osapi calls and partly for the compute manager. I would like it if we could reset the image_ref to the original in case of an error in the rebuild process, but that's maybe not so big a deal.

This is still something I would eventually want to refactor, but it would be part of a different change."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-01-25 06:00:28.000000000', 'message': 'Do not pass image ref through database for rebuild

When rebuilding an instance, pass the image href and image metadata
through to the compute manager rather than through the database. This
change takes advantage of the fact that we are already looking up the
image metadata in glance as a validation step in the compute api.

Change-Id: I4727dc37ea2285803023cd77bc027b8a1716ad71
'}]
commit_message:
Do not pass image ref through database for rebuild

When rebuilding an instance, pass the image href and image metadata
through to the compute manager rather than through the database. This
change takes advantage of the fact that we are already looking up the
image metadata in glance as a validation step in the compute api.

Change-Id: I4727dc37ea2285803023cd77bc027b8a1716ad71

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-02-02 01:55:26.000000000', 'message': "Fix admin password skip check.

Skip admin password configuration only if the agent 'version' is
empty. Previously both the 'version' and 'agent_build' were
required to be set.

As the 'agent_build' table is primarily used for upgrades
there should be no requirement that a record exist in order
to configure admin passwords.

Fixes LP Bug #925237.

Change-Id: Ie4530a30ed02f3d49a07037e9d1cc52ef0af1dd4
"}]
commit_message:
Fix admin password skip check.

Skip admin password configuration only if the agent 'version' is
empty. Previously both the 'version' and 'agent_build' were
required to be set.

As the 'agent_build' table is primarily used for upgrades
there should be no requirement that a record exist in order
to configure admin passwords.

Fixes LP Bug #925237.

Change-Id: Ie4530a30ed02f3d49a07037e9d1cc52ef0af1dd4

[{'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-11 07:24:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Hengqing,

Since you are adding a feature by changing the interface,
I you're going to have to provide test scripts
with your patch.

PS. By the way, the project name is Murder. https://github.com/lg/murder"}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2012-01-11 22:08:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I'm probably missing something, but doesn't passing availability_zone to volume_api.create() need to go in the osapi as well?"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-12 12:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-12 13:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-13 09:55:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Vladimir/dedel needs to sign the CLA before we can merge this, I think"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-13 11:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Just explained this a bit more to Hengqing over email

Vladamir owns the copyright to his patch and hasn't explicitly stated what license he's providing the patch under.

The policy of the project is that copyright holders must sign the CLA before their code can be accepted into Nova.

Perhaps Vladamir is covered by a corporate CLA, but it's not clear what company he works for."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-13 11:42:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I am not aware of these legal issues, should this 'change' be abandoned?"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-13 11:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Included patch from Vladimir@launchpad is not allowed to merge in.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-13 12:04:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I didn't mean for you to abandon this

We just need to get Vladamir to sign the CLA"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-13 12:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

CLA issue is resolved, dedel has signed'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-14 13:23:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Restored

Vladimir(dedel) singed CLA, legal issue resolved.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-14 13:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-14 22:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Great fix.  Could you also add it to:

nova/api/openstack/volume/volumes.py

an added test for the openstack api would b great as well."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-15 13:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-15 15:17:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-16 18:14:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(3 inline comments)

Inline Comments.

Really appreciate the new tests, just a few typos.   We are trying to get to a point where we can remove the volume extension and use the new volume api.  If you can move (or copy) the tests, that would be awesome."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-17 05:29:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-17 06:22:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Excellent work on the tests.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-18 21:44:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

(12 inline comments)

This looks really good, but I've a bunch of small inline comments.

I'm quite concerned about the amount of test code we're copying around here - e.g. do we need 3 identical copies of stub_volume_create() in the codebase. However, Vish appears to suggest above copying the code around, so ...

Also, does it make sense to pass an availability zone to the volume creation in nova/compute/manager.py?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-18 22:00:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

In regards to the code copying: the plan is to deprecate and remove the compute extension for volumes, so I think copying is ok for this case.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-01-18 22:31:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

That covers 1 of the 3 copies, so we're still left with 2 copies, right?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-18 23:13:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Ah i didn't realize it was in vsa as well.  I guess some of those stubs should move into openstack.api.fakes.

Mark, do you think it could be in a different patch?

(Switching to -1 until mark's comments are addressed)"}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-19 10:33:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-19 10:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

1. Question: HACKING.rst indentation violation
   Answer: fixed in patchset 8

2. Question: API change
   Answer: to be consistent with other apis in the code base,
           other apis always use delimiter separted words
           instead of letter case seprated words as parameter.

           consider a user who first use volume api,
           when he tries to create a volume,
           he may use the following body in the request
           {"size": 100,
            "display_name": "Volume Test Name",
            "display_description": "Volume Test Desc",
            "availability_zone": "zone1:host1"}

           later when he switched to vsa volume api,
           when he tries to create a volume,
           he use the following body in the request
           {"size": 100,
            "displayName": "Volume Test Name",
            "displayNescription": "Volume Test Desc",
            "availabilityZone": "zone1:host1"}

           if the apis following the same convention as in the base,
           the user may change less in his own code.

3. Question: remove 'instance is lazy-loaded' lines
   Answer: relates to the following two commits:
           e86f5826
           29940dd2
           
           previously, _translate_volume_summary_view use
           vol.get('instance') to load instance information which
           is lazy-loaded.
           
           now, _translate_volume_summary_view does not use
           instance information anymore.

           a similar example could be found in cloud.py in ec2 api.

           if use a seperated change, the tests need to be changed also.

4. Question: test_objs unused
   Answer: fixed in patchset 8

5. Question: why not kwargs
   Answer: _kwargs indicates it's for api, but not used by the function itself
           so people interested in these kind of uses could easyly identify
           all of them by grep in the code base.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-19 11:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-19 11:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

some update about instance lazy load problem,

now use the same way to handle this problem in os api as
in ec2 api.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-19 18:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

i will ping vladimir about the vsa changes.  I don't think anyone other than zadara is using it, so if they don't mind, I'm ok with consistency."}, {'account_id': 736, 'date': '2012-01-19 21:35:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

This change will introduce some additional work for us, but we can handle it.

However, the bigger question is why do you propose to change input parameters, but don't change output format. I see camel-style fields all over the place in return values (for volumes & others).

We introduced such params in our code only in order to be compliant with rest of the code on both input and output (you can see that internally we always use underscore type of format).

But if input will be in one style and output in another - I prefer to stick with previous version and would ask you to leave VSA-related APIs in current version. I don't want our applications to supply params in one format and read them in different.

thanks
-vladimir"}, {'account_id': 736, 'date': '2012-01-19 22:19:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

pls correct me if I'm wrong, but it seems like the only change required for this bug is in ec2/cloud.py where availability_zone parameter was missing.

Passing availability_zone to scheduler & to volume manager is not really required (even though I suppose this is a right thing to do).
There are only 2 schedulers looking into this field - simple & vsa, but both of them taking availability zone from either base parameters (for instances) or DB (for volumes)."}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-20 02:07:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

It's strange the all the apis use delimeter seprated parameter as input and letter case seprated paramater as output.

I don't know why.

Passing the availability_zone to scheduler is not required at the momemnt, but it's required in the past and maybe in the future for other scheduler.

Anyway this behaviour can be suppressed if not needed."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-20 07:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

So the spec for the api is camelCase and ec2Api is camelCase.  It is much more pythonic to use underscore_separated parameters, so we have endeavored to keep the internal code undserscore_separated (as it should be).  So basically the camelCase output is legacy.  Hopefully we can remove it in v3.  For now perhaps it is best to leave vsa as it is and change it in a different patch.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-20 08:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-20 08:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

updated to exclude vsa api changes'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-01-29 11:04:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 15:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

This has been outstanding for a long time and has great tests.  We should get this in.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:46:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Fails

Build Failed 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/997/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1170/ : This change was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of the repository. Please rebase your change and upload a new patchset. 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/786/ : FAILURE 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2547/ : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:52:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Thanks so much for the work on this. We are ready to merge, looks like it just needs a rebase.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2012-02-02 06:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:50:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

trying again after the rebase.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-tarball/1858/ : SUCCESS'}]

commit_message:
Respect availability_zone parameter in nova api

Fix bug #890209

Include patch from Vladimir@launchpad with little modification.

Accept availability_zone parameter during volume creation in both ec2 and os api.

Add availability_zone test cases for both ec2 and os api.

Move volume test stubs in fakes module for os api test cases.

Use ec2 api's way to handle instance lazy load problem in os api.

Change-Id: I32c3be91906e03ef6c50a028a7b00057678c7609

subject: Support file injection on boot w/ Libvirt
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 112, 'name': 'Jesse Andrews', 'email': 'anotherjesse@gmail.com', 'username': 'anotherjesse'}, {'_account_id': 167, 'name': 'Christian Berendt', 'email': 'berendt@osism.tech', 'username': 'berendt'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 518, 'name': 'Soren Hansen', 'email': 'soren@linux2go.dk', 'username': 'soren'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1801, 'name': 'Duncan McGreggor', 'email': 'duncan.mcgreggor@rackspace.com', 'username': 'oubiwann'}, {'_account_id': 1812, 'name': 'p-draigbrady', 'email': 'P@draigBrady.com', 'username': 'p-draigbrady'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-28 23:11:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-28 23:18:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-28 23:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Looks good. Yes, _create_image() probably is the best place to call this from :)

Do we need to support base64 file contents, or is this done earlier?

Perhaps there could be some refactoring done between disk.api.setup_container() and disk.api.inject_files() ?'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-28 23:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-29 03:46:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This is my first time working in the libvirt driver, so be nice ;) I'm going to revisit nova/disk/api.py with some refactoring once this lands. It's gotten a bit out of hand..."}, {'account_id': 112, 'date': '2012-01-29 04:02:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

I don't like the idea of silent failures, but I also don't know if stopping a launch for failed file injection is a good thing.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-29 18:53:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I would rather fail fast, however, xen doesn't short circuit as it depends on a guest agent to write the files after boot (please correct me if I'm wrong). So if the goal here is to match xen, then we fail and continue with the boot process. If we are going to allow the two methods to have different behavior, then I'm failing up front."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-29 19:46:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Waldon: What if we just logged a warning if the injections fails.

Injecting files in this manner is a good bit more invasive than using an agent... and might throw a wrench into clouds where multiple image formats are used which might not all support file injection with personalities.

We have prior art for this... See line 1056 in libvirt/connection.py...

  except Exception as e:
      # This could be a windows image, or a vmdk format disk
      LOG.warn(_('instance %(inst_name)s: ignoring error injecting'
          ' data into image %(img_id)s (%(e)s)') % locals())"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-29 19:57:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Also. One quick comment on that SmokeStack libvirt failure... I think we'll need to set use_cow_images=False (which I should have already done a long time ago). The reason is because the Cloud Servers kernal doesn't have the required 'nbd' module which is used to manage that type of image. I think that is the reason for the failure there..."}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-29 21:16:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If there is no nbd module, perhaps guestmount is available, which would be used instead? That's part of the libguestfs-mount package on fedora at least"}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-01-30 14:22:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So you're adding the code to do injection to the hypervisor agnostic disk/api.py, and then consume that from libvirt... So XenServer uses an entirely different bit of code to do this injection?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-30 17:27:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Soren: yep -- guest agent'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-30 17:29:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Looks Good.  Dan: I do like the option of using libguestfs for the smokestack version since nbd doesn't work."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-30 17:48:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

As for failing up front vs logging a warning:

I think I am on the side of failing up front. If a request asks for a file to be injected and that file is subsequently *not* injected, that's a failure. If we can't inject files into a specific format, then the user shouldn't request to do so."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-01-30 18:40:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I would prefer option 1 ("Log an error, set the instance to ERROR, add an asynchronous fault to the instance in the db") as suggested in your mail on openstack@lists.launchpad.net.

If I use the injection normally I'll do that because I've to provide the network configuration this way (because customer doesn't allow the use of DHCP by some kind of policies).

If the injection failed the instance will not be available by using SSH and this is FAILED in my opinion.

If you prefer option 2 ("Log a warning, move on with the boot process") it should be configurable to only write a warning message in the logs or to set the instance to FAILED.

So everybody can choose his expected behavior.'}, {'account_id': 1801, 'date': '2012-01-30 18:46:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm +1 on option #1."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:11:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm leaning towards 1.  It seems like features that are user-requested that fail should cause an error.  The admin password feature is a bit of an oddball because it isn't user requested."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-30 19:36:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Okay. Besides the 'admin password' example I gave on the list I have one more thing to mention.

---

Keypairs: We don't go into an ERROR state if keypairs fail to get injected for some reason. I realize keypairs use a different mechanism (a metadata service) but this is worth noting.

I guess the thing that bothers me with this is we treat all these types of things a bit differently with regard to the error state of the instance. A failure for any of these things (admin password, keypair, file injection) could leave a customer unhappy.

---

For that matter. Given that we are doing this for personalities do we want to consider a similar type of injection for keypairs as well? There is a keypairs extension in the OSAPI and there is nothing in a SPEC that says it has to be done over a metadata service right?"}, {'account_id': 518, 'date': '2012-01-30 22:26:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Soren: yep -- guest agent

So no guest agent means no file injection on XenServer? How do we know that there's going to be a guest agent in the instance ?"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-31 03:12:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just wanted to give a quick update on this....

I'm getting mixed results with using the loop mounting on Cloud Servers with Oneiric. If this lands as is my options are:

-disable the personalities tests in Torpedo (I'd leave them in the suite but configured off for Libvirt on Cloud Servers). This would stop the injection issue and allow me to continue using cow (the default)

-figure out how to make loop work better on libvirt cloud servers. I have instances boot with it but the sometimes go into error state. Using loop appears to be extremely slow and sometime unreliable... I will tinker with this more tomorrow.

-switch to libguestfs. Doesn't appear to be an option on Ubuntu. Would be an option on Fedora.

-Worst case scenario I patch out this change in the packages because it is a show stopper for my testing.

I don't expect everyone cares about SmokeStack... so I won't hold this up. However you may hit similar issues with devstack as well. Especially if we move towards test suites which actually use personalities like Torpedo or Tempest.

---

Other than the config related issues I am personally hitting I don't have an issue with going into ERROR state if the injection fails.

If anyone has ideas let me know. I'd like to keep smoking!"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-01-31 03:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

"I don't expect everyone cares about SmokeStack"

Definitely not the case! SmokeStack is providing a vital gating service at the moment. Let's resolve the issues that are seen before moving forward with this, IMHO.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-01-31 09:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Dan, what are the cloud servers running that nbd is not available, and loop is slow/unreliable?

Could perhaps the precise, wheezy/sid or upstream
libguestfs packages be used?

http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/libguestfs-tools
http://packages.debian.org/search?keywords=libguestfs
http://libguestfs.org/download/binaries/'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-01-31 17:25:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Okay. The final scoop....

The reason loop was misbehaving for me was that libvirt image caching was copying images from base after they had been resized. This greatly increases the disk IO/space required to do smoke tests and thus slowed things down quite a bit (exceeding timeouts across the board). pixelbeat has some ideas on how to speed this up in a separate and unrelated merge prop.

So here is what we do to make this work in the meantime:

1) I turned off COW images. 

2) I'm not using flavor ref 1 which has a size of 0. This essentially eliminates the extra copy overhead mentioned above and allows the tests to run fine.

----

Other than that it sounds like the consensus is to go into ERROR state which I'm fine with. I was leaning against but now I'm for it as well."}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2012-02-01 06:43:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Agree with Jay; if SmokeStack pops an error, it should at least be looked into."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:41:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Kevin/Jay:

I've made some configuration changes to SmokeStack so that it runs now.

Feel free to approve/send this one!"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Also. See my previous comments from yesterday about the configuration changes, etc.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-01 20:44:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Kevin: If you look at the response from Dan, he investigated and fixed the problem.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-02-01 23:45:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ah, OK; in that case…'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Approved

jay's comment was addressed."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:11:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-integration-tests-devstack-vm/1026/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-merge/1194/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-unittests/808/ : SUCCESS 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-nova-pep8/2574/ : SUCCESS'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-02-02 07:14:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Build Successful 
 
https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/nova-tarball/1857/ : SUCCESS'}]

subject: Nova API doesn't return instance security groups
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 518, 'name': 'Soren Hansen', 'email': 'soren@linux2go.dk', 'username': 'soren'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1132, 'name': 'Brian Waldon', 'email': 'brian@waldon.cc', 'username': 'bcwaldon'}, {'_account_id': 1994, 'name': 'Zhongyue Luo', 'email': 'zhongyue.luo@gmail.com', 'username': 'zyluo'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2230, 'name': 'Paul McMillan', 'email': 'paul@mcmillan.ws', 'username': 'paul-mcmillan'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-01-19 16:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-19 17:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Truth be told, I only tried this out on Essex-2.

I'm trying to get my bleeding nova env to work but so much has changed within just two weeks!

I hope Paul could try it out before it gets committed."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-19 17:23:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

I like what you're trying to do, but I would prefer to see all the security group stuff done in the extension we already have. Have you looked into taking that approach?"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-19 17:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The purpose of this patch is mainly because 1)the current security_group API extension does not support retrieving the security groups associated with an instance and 2)to cope with the ec2 api which as of bug 802046 returns the security groups associated with an instance.

Yes I did expect controversy with this patch but if security groups were to move to core (which I'm not sure) I though this would cut the tape.

If it is inappropriate, I'll try to implement this on the security group extension retrieving instance ids associated with a security group."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-19 17:47:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would strongly encourage you to implement this in the extension itself. It is entirely possible that security groups could be elevated to core status in the v3 API, but it will never be core in v2.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-19 18:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

got it. thanks!'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-20 02:09:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't submit this

Rain check till OSAPI v3"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-01-20 02:30:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Keep in  mind that we will probably not have a stable v3 api until the G release cycle.

I was also looking around today and noticed the 'createserverext' extension does some work to expose security groups on a list servers call. You might want to look into that."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-01-20 02:52:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks. I'll take a look at it."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-02-01 21:41:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do you still want to push this change through, or does it make sense to abandon it and move on?'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-02-02 01:31:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Abandoned

I'll be back"}]

commit_message:
Nova API doesn't return instance security groups

Fixes Bug #909207

Added a workaround to get security group API extension bookmark links which
should be fixed after security groups moves back to core

Change-Id: I906cd9ba809b78c4ae8cffba2d258f618b51a8e9
